fr.uga.pddl4j.util

Class BitExp

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.uga.pddl4j.util.BitExp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BitExp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements an bit set expression. A bit set expression is used to encode preconditions (negative and positive) but also effects of the instantiated operators.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitExp()
      Creates a new bit set expression.
      BitExp(BitExp other)
      Creates a new bit expression from an other one.
      BitExp(BitVector positive, BitVector negative)
      Creates a new bit expression from a specified positive and negative bit set that represent respectively the positive and the negative fact of the expression.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int cardinality()
      Returns the cardinality of the bit expression, i.e., the number of propositions contained in the expression.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Return if a specified object is equals to this expression.
      BitVector getNegative()
      Returns the bit set that represents the negative facts of the expression.
      BitVector getPositive()
      Returns the bit set that represents the positive facts of the expression.
      int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value of the expression.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns if the expression is empty, i.e., the expression has no positive and no negative facts.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitExp

        public BitExp()
        Creates a new bit set expression. By default the expression has no positive and no negative fact.

      • BitExp

        public BitExp(BitExp other)
       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new bit expression from an other one.
        Parameters:
        other - the other one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if other == null.

      • BitExp

        public BitExp(BitVector positive,
              BitVector negative)
       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new bit expression from a specified positive and negative bit set that represent respectively the positive and the negative fact of the expression.
        Parameters:
        positive - the bit set that represents the positive facts of the expression.
        negative - the bit set that represents the negative facts of the expression.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if positive == null || negative == null.

        Returns the bit set that represents the negative facts of the expression.
        Returns:

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Returns if the expression is empty, i.e., the expression has no positive and no negative facts. Such an expression is always true.
        Returns:
        true if the expression is empty; false otherwise.

      • cardinality

        public final int cardinality()
        Returns the cardinality of the bit expression, i.e., the number of propositions contained in the expression.
        Returns:
        the cardinality of the bit expression.

        Returns the hash code value of the expression.

        See Also:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Return if a specified object is equals to this expression. The specified object is equal to the expression if and only if the object is an instance of the class BitExp and it has the same positive and negative facts.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the specified object to compared.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to the expression; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Object.equals(java.lang.Object)
